intro: Thyrsacanthus angustissimus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thrysa, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its thick, waxy leaves. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
